name: Edible Hair Conditioner
description: I was experimenting with various healthy oils to make a hair conditioner and came up with this... Use the solid product as conditioner... liquid will be left, drink it! So yummy!

recipeInstructions.text: Combine soy milk, coconut oil, and olive oil in a sealable microwave-safe container.
Microwave until coconut oil is liquid, about 15 seconds. Seal container and shake vigorously until blended, about 10 seconds. Freeze until solid, about 1 hour.
Scoop out conditioner and rub between your hands to warm. Apply to hair. Cover hair with a shower cap. Leave in for 20 minutes, or up to overnight. Rinse out of hair.

review.reviewBody: This was better than any leave in treatment I have ever used. I have long hair and also have to color it due to grays so a deep conditioning is a must for me every month. Edible and hair in the same sentence are a big NO for me so I did not eat this but the solid works great on the hair. I've been using coconut oil in my hair for a couple of years now but this combo worked even better. I am fortunate not to be split end prone but I am prone to tangling and this worked wonders. After freezing I just let it sit out until it was room temp and used it like that. If 20 minutes is all you have then that is okay but I recommend leaving it in for at least an hour. Now that I know this works I'll leave it in overnight next time.

Part one - Made this tonight. It s on my hair right now but unless it really hydrates it I likely won t do again. I found that the milk separated slightly which is not a huge deal. I used 90% of it on my hair as it s longish but since it s been on the oils have warmed from my scalp and have been dripping down my face and back (even with a shower cap on) I will re-evaluate if this works well on the hair as that is the main objective. I would definitely put up with these little issues if it works wonders on my hair. Don t think I could sleep with it on though as oil would be all over the bedding. Part 2- originally gave this 3 stars but changed my rating! I m finding today after washing/drying my hair it looks much healthier after just the one treatment. I m going to use this 2-3 times a week????
